search_term: Find the official pricing page URL for Qonto (qonto.com). Only provide the exact URL to the pricing page, not a summary of pricing information.
response_text: Here is the official pricing page URL for Qonto: [https://qonto.com/en/pricing](https://qonto.com/en/pricing)【3:0†source】.

citations.title: Pricing: Qonto | Find the right plan for your business

extracted_content.content:

**Limited offer**: Accounts Receivable add-on at €29/month for one year. Offer ends 30/06/2025\*.

⏰ Accounts Receivable add-on €29/month\*

Add-ons

Now, enhance your plan…
-----------------------

Select add-ons for extra automation, scalability, and customization features. Options for when your business needs more.

Annual (up to -20%)

Monthly

Annual (up to -20%)

Empowering 500,000+ businesses
------------------------------

Payment cards for all business needs
------------------------------------

### X Card

Spend up to €200,000/month, with no fees when you pay in foreign currencies. A 17-gram metal card available in a choice of 3 colors.

### Plus Card

Double your warranty coverage and halve your exchange rate fees. Monthly cash withdrawals up to €2,000 and digital payments up to €40,000.

### One Card

A simple, efficient card that’s included in your plan: withdraw up to €1,000 and make payments up to €20,000 per month, fraudulent payment-insured.

### Instant Card

Ideal for one-off expenses. Create them quickly for a single purchase, or for several purchases to be made in a short period of time.

### Virtual Card

Compatible with Apple Pay and Google Pay for purchases online and in-store. Customize payment limits easily from your Qonto app.

![Image 1: Purple  SEO Highlight Pricing Recommender](https://qonto.com/blog/images/asset/11663/image/ccae09f749e0e88d74f7ccd35fca5078.svg)

### Don’t know which price plan to choose?

Answer a few simple questions, and we’ll suggest the plan we think would suit your business best.

![Image 2: UI Mockup Parallax Dashboard History PlusCard XCard Mobile Asset](https://qonto.com/blog/images/asset/12438/image/96febe31e3407f4813fbb4645987b59d.png)

Our customers say it best
-------------------------

Our customers say it best
-------------------------

1 of 2

![Image 3: clients logo testimonial alan](https://qonto.com/blog/images/asset/9263/image/eb61c3c637c99d383769727151aa993b.svg)

### “Qonto is 100% aligned with what we do at Alan: a straightforward service, a customer-oriented interface, and ultra-fast customer service!”

Jean-Charles Samuelian

Founder @Alan

2 of 2

### “I created my company with Qonto. Opening an account only took me 10 minutes, while the customer service is excellent and the design user-friendly. I'm so happy with it!”

Géraldine Vivo

Founder @Louve

Open an account in 10 minutes
-----------------------------

We want to protect what’s precious to you as an entrepreneur: your time, energy, and focus. Let Qonto get your finance admin done faster, right from the very first click.

30-day free trial.

_\*Limited offer available until 30/06/2025. Accounts Receivable add-on at €29/month (instead of €35/month) for one year when billed annually, or at €35/month (instead of €45/month) when billed monthly. At the end of this promotion, Qonto’s standard prices will apply. The Terms & Conditions of this offer may be modified at any time - [see the full details here](https://legal.qonto.com/#special-offer-ar-q2-2025-en)._

Frequently Asked Questions
--------------------------

Qonto is not a bank but rather a payment institution supervised by the Banque de France (under the number CIB 16958). We enable companies (existing ones or those in the process of being registered) to benefit from a payment account and all the means of payment necessary for the smooth running of their business (physical and virtual cards, direct debits, international transfers, cheque deposits).

As a regulated payment institution, all our customers’ funds are secured. The funds deposited in your Qonto account are totally separate from Qonto’s treasury.

The funds are partly “segregated” in the books of Crédit Mutuel Arkéa. The other part is invested in qualified money market funds, the units of which are held in the books of Société Générale in accordance with our legal and regulatory obligations. This means that no one but you has access to your money. Neither Qonto nor anyone else can use or invest your company’s money.

For more information please refer to [this article](https://qonto9015.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/23947671909905-how-are-my-funds-protected).

Whether your company is already registered or is in the process of being created, we have **offers adapted to all** to guide you through the different stages of your company's life.

Whether you are alone or in a team, Qonto provides you with all the payment methods you need to manage your business in real time. Qonto offers **metal cards** for professionals and allows the reception of **SWIFT transfers** (from abroad).

Much more than a current account, Qonto simplifies your daily life with a range of features that make it easier to keep an eye on everyone's expenses and prepare your daily accounting.

Since 2019, we have been using **our own banking platform** (also known as the Core Banking System), which allows us to carry out our clients' transactions ourselves. This independence allows us to offer a smoother experience to our clients and to directly create the products and services that make their day-to-day life easier.

Our mission is focused on the needs of professionals and their expectations. This is why our customer service is **ultra responsive** and **attentive**, with people ready to answer your questions as quickly as possible.

Qonto's pricing and offers are **transparent**. All monthly subscriptions come **without commitments**. You can switch from one plan to another at any time if your business needs to change.

500,000 business customers have already joined Qonto to simplify their day-to-day financial management - why not you?

Qonto is designed for all professionals and companies who wish to **optimize their daily financial and accounting management**. The opening of a Qonto business current account is currently accessible to companies registered in **France** (SA, SAS, SASU, SARL, SC & SCI, EURL, liberal professions, micro-enterprises). **Italian, Spanish or German companies** also have the possibility to manage their finances on Qonto. In France, Qonto also allows registered associations to create an account for professional purposes.

Qonto also makes it easier to set up a business by giving future entrepreneurs the opportunity to **open an account** and deposit the **initial share capital** (excluding SCIs and companies domiciled in French overseas departments and territories) required to register and obtain their Kbis and SIREN number.

There is **no movement commission** in addition to the cost of the subscription.

In other words, if you do not exceed the transaction volume and services included in your subscription, **you will only be charged for the monthly rate** of your subscription.

If you order additional cards or make additional transactions (over those included in your subscription), additional fees will be charged. Find all the details on the fees for additional cards and services [here.](https://qonto.com/en/pricing#solo)

**Transfers**

Your Qonto account allows you to receive transfers from all over the world and send money in more than **32 foreign currencies via the SWIFT network.** This feature is included in some of our plans. Discover all our plans and what they include from our [Pricing page](https://qonto.com/en/pricing#solo).

**Payments by card**

All of our Qonto cards accompany and insure you when you travel. If you are a frequent traveler, we advise you to order one of our **Plus or X Cards**.

With the Plus Card you benefit from a low, **1% exchange rate commission** on card payments outside the Euro zone.

With the X Card, all your payments abroad are made at **the real exchange rate** (without any exchange commission) and your withdrawals are free of charge.

These two cards come with **premium insurance** to protect you and your teams when travelling.

**SEPA Creditor Identifier creation**

The SEPA Creditor Identifier (ICS) enables you to debit your customers' accounts via SEPA Direct Debit.

**Confirmation letter**

It is a regulatory document that companies may need annually in the event of an audit. Please note that Qonto **will not charge you any additional fees** for requesting a confirmation letter.

**Management of irregularities**

Qonto will charge you **10%** of the amount requested by the seizing authority, up to **a maximum of €100 excl. VAT.**

An irregularity occurs when the tax administration or a creditor through a legal authority demands reimbursement of an unpaid debt. As a payment institution, we are required to take the steps to reimburse your debt: this is what we call a seizure of bank accounts.

**Capital increase (France only)**

\- Capital increase of less than €1.2 million with a maximum of 15 shareholders and with the funds coming exclusively from French bank accounts: **€150 excl. VAT**.

\- Capital increase of less than €1.2 million with a maximum of 15 shareholders and with the funds coming, in whole or in part, from bank accounts outside of France: **€250 excl. VAT**.

\- Capital increase of between €1.2 million and €5 million, and/or with between 15 and 30 shareholders, and/or with the funds coming, in whole or in part, from bank accounts outside of France: **€300 excl. VAT**.

A capital increase enables the creation of new shares, which can then be purchased by one of the current shareholders or by a new shareholder.

As a Qonto customer, your subscription fees are collected directly from your Qonto account. You can choose to be billed on either a monthly basis or, alternatively, to pay upfront for a full year by choosing our annual payment option.

Newly-formed companies subscribing to one of our company creators’ plans will make their first payment to Qonto when they register for their plan.

If your company already existed before you signed up to a Qonto plan, your first payment to Qonto will be due at the end of your 30-day free trial period.

If you choose to be billed on a monthly basis, your first payment will be calculated according to the number of days remaining in the month in which you registered your Qonto account. Thereafter, your following subscription payments will be billed on the first day of each month. Any additional fees, for example for extra payment cards or operations not included in your plan, will be billed as and when they occur.

If you choose to pay annually for your Qonto account, the amount of your first payment will be calculated based on the number of days remaining in the month you subscribed to the account + 11 full months (to complete for a full year). After this first annual payment, you will be billed each year for a full yearly fee. Any additional fees, for example for extra payment cards or operations not included in your plan, will be billed as and when they occur.

In cases where there are insufficient funds in your Qonto account to pay your Qonto subscription, Qonto has made the choice not to apply penalty fees on your overdue payments, as other institutions do. Instead, you will be notified of a "payment failure" and will be asked to top up your account so that your payment can be processed next.

An ‘Add-on’ is a package of additional features that you can add to your Qonto plan. These paid packages provide you with complementary tools to enhance your experience and allow you to tailor Qonto’s offer to your specific business needs.

If you pay for your Qonto plan on a monthly basis, the additional fees for an Add-on will also be billed monthly.

If you pay for your Qonto plan on an annual basis, you can choose to be billed for any Add-ons either monthly or annually.

See all Qonto account plans and prices. ✓ From €9/month. ✓ Over 500,000 customers. Compare plans and open an account now.

pricing_data.pricing_notes: Pricing includes VAT-exclusive rates and offers annual billing discounts.

pricing_tiers.tier_description: A business account with essential invoicing capabilities for easy everyday financial management.
An advanced business account with performance dashboards, integrated invoicing and bookkeeping.
For high-volume solopreneurs who need priority support, with extra accounts and dedicated IBANs.

additional_fees.fee_description: Capital increase of less than €1.2 million with a maximum of 15 shareholders and with the funds coming exclusively from French bank accounts.
Capital increase of less than €1.2 million with a maximum of 15 shareholders and with the funds coming, in whole or in part, from bank accounts outside of France.
Capital increase of between €1.2 million and €5 million, and/or with between 15 and 30 shareholders, and/or with the funds coming, in whole or in part, from bank accounts outside of France.
